moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 d6 3. Nc3: Book play in the Old Indian Defense.
moves.5... Be7 6. g3 O-O 7. Bg2: Both players hasten to complete their development.
moves.9... exd4 10. Qxd4 Ne5 11. f4: Since White is compelled to lose a Pawn, he seeks compensation with a strong Pawn center and a K-side attack.
moves.11... c5 12. Qf2 Nxc4 13. b3: Forcing the Knight away from the K-side.
moves.13... Na5 14. Bb2 Nc6 15. Rad1: Centralizing his Rook and pressuring Black's backward QP. The move also strengthens his grip on Q5, which would make a superb outpost for a Knight.
moves.15... Qa5 16. g4 Nd4 17. Nxd4: Squelching Tchigorin's attempt at counterplay immediately.
moves.17... cxd4 18. b4 Qxb4 19. Rxd4: Opening more lines for attack. Black's isolated QP and lagging development are crimping his game.
moves.19... Qa5 20. g5 Nd7 21. Nd5: Seizing this powerful outpost at once. Depending on your taste in metaphors, this Knight is a rusty nail in Tchigorin's knee or a bone in his throat.
moves.21... Qd8 22. h4 Nb6 23. f5: Forcing Tchigorin to remove the Knight, but this opens the diagonal of Cohn's QB, which aims ominously at Tchigorin's King.
moves.23... Nxd5 24. Rxd5 Bd7 25. e5: A very powerful move. If Tchigorin now plays 25... PxP?? Cohn has 26 P-B6!! P-KN3 27 B-KR3!! and Tchigorin can resign.
moves.25... Bc6 26. e6: 26... BxR? now falls to 27 BxB PxP 28 PxP Q-K2 29 Q-Q4!!! and Tchigorin has no defense against 30 R-B7.
moves.26... fxe6 27. fxe6: Now 27... BxR? fails to 28 Q-B7 ch K-R1 29 BxB R-K2 30 Q-B5 K-N1 31 B-K4!! and Black is defenseless.
moves.27... Qe7 28. Qf7+ Kh8 29. Rdf5: White's powerful battery on the KB file threatens to break into Black's position decisively.
moves.29... Qxf7 30. exf7 Re2 31. Rf1f2: Now Cohn has a promotion threat as well as mating threats.
moves.31... Rxf2 32. Rxf2 d5 33. Bd4: Preventing Black from gaining counterplay with ...B-B4.
moves.33... h5 34. g6 Bd7 35. Re2: THreatening 36 R-K5 followed by 37 RxP mate.
moves.35... Bd6 36. Bh3 Bb5 37. Re6: Tchigorin resigns. If 37... B-B2, Cohn has 38 B-QB5! B-N3 39 BxB PxB 40 R-K5 forcing mate.
